docs.snippet: Archaeologists say humans reached what is now northeast Brazil as early as 22,000 years ago, upending a prevailing belief of 20th-century archaeology in the United States that people arrived in the Americas about 13,000 years ago.
docs.lead_paragraph: Archaeologists say humans reached what is now northeast Brazil as early as 22,000 years ago, upending a prevailing belief of 20th-century archaeology in the United States that people arrived in the Americas about 13,000 years ago.
docs.abstract: Serra da Capivara National Park Journal; researchers working near ancient rock art paintings in Serra da Capivara National Park in Brazil have unearthed stone tools that they say prove humans reached northeast Brazil as early as 22,000 years ago; discovery upends prevailing belief that people first arrive in Americas from Asia 13,000 years ago.

headline.main: Discoveries Challenge Beliefs on Humans’ Arrival in the Americas
headline.kicker: Serra Da Capivara National Park Journal
headline.print_headline: Discoveries Challenge Beliefs on Humans’ Arrival in the Americas
headline.content_kicker: Serra Da Capivara National Park Journal

docs.snippet: Asian champions Japan will play Costa Rica and Zambia in Florida in early June as their final warm-up matches before the World Cup in Brazil, the country's soccer association said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Asian champions Japan will play Costa Rica and Zambia in Florida in early June as their final warm-up matches before the World Cup in Brazil, the country's soccer association said on Friday.

headline.main: Japan to Play Costa Rica, Zambia Before World Cup
headline.print_headline: Japan to Play Costa Rica, Zambia Before World Cup

docs.snippet: Winning the World Cup for a sixth time matters more to Brazil than putting on a display of the "beautiful game", Brazil technical director Carlos Alberto Parreira said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Winning the World Cup for a sixth time matters more to Brazil than putting on a display of the "beautiful game", Brazil technical director Carlos Alberto Parreira said on Friday.

headline.main: Winning Trumps Style for Pragmatic Brazilians
headline.print_headline: Winning Trumps Style for Pragmatic Brazilians

docs.snippet: Uruguay's drug czar says every legal marijuana plant in Uruguay will be registered and tracked using radio frequency tags, and that state-grown marijuana will be cloned to include genetic markers, making sure that what's grown here, stays here.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's drug czar says every legal marijuana plant in Uruguay will be registered and tracked using radio frequency tags, and that state-grown marijuana will be cloned to include genetic markers, making sure that what's grown here, stays here.

headline.main: Uruguay to Track Pot by Genetic Markers
headline.print_headline: Uruguay to Track Pot by Genetic Markers

docs.snippet: Kevin Johansen’s performance at Le Poisson Rouge on Wednesday reflected his peripatetic life, his rejection of genres and a fondness for the clip-clop of cumbia.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kevin Johansen’s performance at Le Poisson Rouge on Wednesday reflected his peripatetic life, his rejection of genres and a fondness for the clip-clop of cumbia.
docs.abstract: Jon Pareles reviews performance by singer-songwriter Kevin Johansen at Le Poisson Rouge.

headline.seo: Kevin Johansen Is Not a Genre Kind of Guy
headline.main: Traveling Man, Able to Rock Cowbells
headline.print_headline: Traveling Man, Able to Rock Cowbells

docs.snippet: FIFA said that more than 2.5 million tickets have been sold for the World Cup, with tickets remaining for only seven games.

headline.main: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 75

docs.snippet: Andrew Suniula scored two tries two minutes apart and the United States rallied from a 10-point deficit to beat Uruguay, 32-13, earning the Eagles another trip to the Rugby World Cup next year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrew Suniula scored two tries two minutes apart and the United States rallied from a 10-point deficit to beat Uruguay, 32-13, earning the Eagles another trip to the Rugby World Cup next year.

docs.snippet: Bill Fales wanted a new baler and a better irrigation system for the 700-acre ranch where he raises grass-fed beef cattle, but he scrapped those plans when he saw his new health insurance premiums.

docs.snippet: Juventus coach Antonio Conte has issued a stinging rebuke to Napoli coach Rafael Benitez after the two bickered over which team had spent the more money.
